info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 2 at 12:28PM CDT until April 2 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS Chicago IL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of northwest Indiana, including the following county, Lake IN.
* WHEN...Until 445 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Underpasses may be flooded. Roads and streets may be flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1224 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated that heavy rainfall had moved out of the area with only light shower activity ongoing. Minor flooding will likely continue for the next few hours. Up to 2 inches of rainfall occurred due to earlier shower and storm activity. - Additional shower and thunderstorm activity remains possible into the afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hammond, Gary, Portage, Merrillville, East Chicago, Schererville, Hobart, Crown Point, Highland, Munster, Cedar Lake, Griffith, Dyer, St. John, Lake Station, Lakes of the Four Seasons, Whiting, Winfield, New Chicago and Lake Dalecarlia. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON
